intro: Gabonius ngouniensis, commonly known as the Ngouni tree, is a medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, spherical fruits that are yellow when ripe. It is often found in humid lowland forests and is valued for its timber and fruit. The plant also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
